docs.lead_paragraph: "As people get more frail and old, physicians tend to do more, when often we should do less."
docs.abstract: A study finds that residents of two nursing homes were routinely overtreated with antibiotics for common urinary tract infections -- a widespread practice, the researchers said.
docs.snippet: A study finds that residents of two nursing homes were routinely overtreated with antibiotics for common urinary tract infections -- a widespread practice, the researchers said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Blumberg’s work led to the discovery of the hepatitis B virus in 1967, the first test for hepatitis B in the blood supply and the development of the hepatitis B vaccine.

headline.seo: Baruch S. Blumberg,Who Helped Make Hepatitis Vaccine, Dies
headline.main: Baruch Blumberg, Who Discovered and Tackled Hepatitis B, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Baruch S. Blumberg Is Dead at 85; Helped Develop a Hepatitis Vaccine

docs.snippet: Dr. Blumberg’s work led to the discovery of the hepatitis B virus in 1967, the first test for hepatitis B in the blood supply and the development of the hepatitis B vaccine.

docs.lead_paragraph: TAUB--Henry. Columbia University Medical Center mourns the passing of our great friend Henry Taub, whose generosity and foresight allowed us to establish The Taub Institute for Research on Alzheimer's Disease and the Aging Brain. As a great champion of medical research, his continuing advocacy and philanthropy have been vital to our ongoing work to uncover the causes of age-related brain diseases, and to discover ways to prevent and cure them. All of us at Columbia will miss his warmth, humor, intellect and friendship, and we extend our condolences to his wife, Marilyn; his children, Judith, Steven and Ira; and the extended Taub family. Lee Goldman, MD Dean of the Faculties of Health Sciences and Medicine Executive Vice President, Columbia University Richard Mayeux, MD, MSc Gertrude H. Sergievsky Professor of Neurology, Psychiatry & Epidemiology Chairman, Department of Neurology Co-Director, Taub Institute Michael L. Shelanski, MD, PhD Delafield Professor and Chairman Department of Pathology and Cell Biology Co-Director, Taub Institute

docs.lead_paragraph: A rise in programs sending doctors to some of the world’s poorest countries has met with an outpouring of enthusiasm from many recent graduates.

headline.seo: Doctors Go Far Afield to Battle Epidemics

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal law for free dialysis is being questioned because most of the patients who take advantage of it are elderly.

headline.seo: Federal Dialysis Program Is Questioned by Kidney Specialists
headline.main: When Ailments Pile Up, Asking Patients to Rethink Free Dialysis
headline.print_headline: Asking Kidney Patients to Forgo a Free Lifeline
